text: If you can generate a string that represents "this tuesday", you can use that as a starting point for adding weeks

So `local_dt` gets the current time, and you could use `|datetimeformat` to break out the day of the week/day of the month, then add days depending on what day of the week it is.
Then rebuild the datetime string in a format for `|strtotime`, and then you could use that in your loop to get each Tuesday after.

`{% do obj.put(foo, 'XYZ') %}` works.


You can find documentation for lists and maps from <http://javadoc.io|javadoc.io> - click `com.HubSpot.jinjava.objects.collections` and then `PyList` or `PyMap` accordingly.
